title: Stephanie Cheng
text:
Relevant coursework: data visualization, geospatial analysis, policy research and development, real-time urban data sensing, urban design
Climate Leaders at Penn Fellow (2023-2024)
GPA: 3.86








Grade: First Class Honours (Summa Cum Laude equivalent)
“The Legitimacy of Legal Egalitarianism”: research paper presented at BCUR 2021 (British Conference of Undergraduate Research)
“Protests: The Spatial Choreographies of Public Space”: podcast on the impact of urban design on protest movements and public dissent
Extra-curricular roles: Koan Records (Legal Advisor), Association of British/Chinese University Students (Marketing Director)








5-week course with an interdisciplinary approach to urban innovation, design, and analysis: produced an 80-year resilience plan of urban designs focused on climate change adaptation and natural disaster mitigation in Singapore

title: Stephanie Cheng
text:
Professional Experience

New York City Economic Development Corporation (NYCEDC) New York, NY

Transportation and Offshore Wind Intern (June-August 2023)

Drafted two grant applications for Staten Island offshore wind sites: one to secure $500,000 of pre-development funding for the Rossville site to support its development as a manufacturing and assembling site for wind turbine components, and another to secure $20 million of capital infrastructure improvement funding for the SIMT site as a marine highway and potential offshore wind site
Analyzed community benefit agreements of airport redevelopments (LAX and ATL) as models for JFK Airport’s “A New JFK” project
Researched current NYC energy policy, objectives, and barriers regarding the city’s sustainability goals, namely 2050 carbon neutrality
Facilitated the planning, marketing, and execution of 5 events as part of the “Summer of Offshore Wind” educational community engagement initiatives: engaged with 25-60 NYC residents per event about upcoming offshore wind site developments and job growth




ECOLAND Planning & Design Beijing, China

Freelance Editorial Advisor (May 2022-June 2023)

Edited and revised 12 project deliverables of the Tongzhou, Beijing Sustainable Waterfront Park development project to the 2022 British Association of Landscape Industries competition and 2023 Rosa Barba Casanovas International Landscape Architecture Prize
Edited and revised a presentation and project narrative for the American Society of Landscape Architects Communications competition

title: Stephanie Cheng
text:
Leadership Experience

Urban Tech Club University of Pennsylvania

Treasurer (September 2023-Present)

Supported the founding of UPenn’s first Urban Tech Club, supporting peer mentorship, careers advancement, and urban tech academia
Organized 4 events including professional practice speaker events and tech/coding workshops
Managed club finances: recorded initial $500 club budget spending on events and applied for external funding sources




Warwick K-pop Society University of Warwick

Founder, President, Dance Production Leader of KONCEPT K-pop dance team (September 2019-May 2022)

Founded Warwick’s first K-pop Society: developed branding and social media presence, gathered support from interested students, secured sponsorships with 3 relevant local businesses, organised 13 events in one academic year with an attendance of 40-60 students each
Recruited six other executive team members and achieved recognition from the Warwick Students’ Union as an official student society

title: Stephanie Cheng
text:
Skills and Interests

Data Analysis/Programming Skills: R, Python, SQL, C/C++, ESRI ArcGIS Pro/Online, Excel
Media Skills: Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator/InDesign, Final Cut Pro X, Logic Pro X
Legal Research: LexisLibrary Foundation and Advanced Certifications (legal research database)
Professional Interests: Digital Equity, Fair Algorithms, Transportation Planning, Climate Tech, Renewable Energy, Climate Change Mitigation/Adaptation, Urban Data, Smart Cities, Urban Sensors
Other Interests: A cappella (performed at the 2022 National Tree Lighting Ceremony in Washington D.C.), bass guitar, maps, K-pop

title: Stephanie Cheng
text:
Stephanie is an Urban Planner, Data Analyst, and Smart City Enthusiast with a background in Law. Having lived in China, Singapore, Hong Kong, UK, and now USA, Stephanie is inspired by a range of urban issues in cities across the world. She is particularly interested in how technology and data can be effectively and equitably used to solve urban and environmental issues. Stephanie most recently worked as the Offshore Wind Intern at New York City Economic Development Corporation, and is passionate about supporting the global shift towards renewable energy.
Stephanie is a current Master of City Planning candidate at the University of Pennsylvania (expected May 2024), with a First Class Bachelor of Laws (LLB) from the University of Warwick (2022).



 Back to top

title: Silvia Canelón, PhD
text:
I am a researcher and R educator with a love for community. My research leverages electronic health record and spatial data to study the intersection of health equity and urban nature. My community projects value the partnership between open source tools and data literacy as a way to build power and effect change.
Learn more about me →
